00001 ########################################################################### 
00002 #
00003 #  Implements Vector class
00004 #
00005 package Value::Vector;
00006 my $pkg = 'Value::Vector';
00007 
00008 use strict; no strict "refs";
00009 our @ISA = qw(Value);
00010 
00011 #
00012 #  Convert a value to a Vector.  The value can be
00013 #    a list of numbers, or a reference to an array of numbers
00014 #    a point or vector object (demote a vector)
00015 #    a matrix if it is  n x 1  or  1 x n
00016 #    a string that parses to a vector
00017 #
00018 sub new {
00019   my $self = shift; my $class = ref($self) || $self;
00020   my $context = (Value::isContext($_[0]) ? shift : $self->context);
00021   my $p = shift; $p = [$p,@_] if scalar(@_) > 0;
00022   $p = Value::makeValue($p,context=>$context) if defined($p) && !ref($p);
00023   return $p if Value::isFormula($p) && Value::classMatch($self,$p->type);
00024   my $isFormula = 0; my @d; @d = $p->dimensions if Value::classMatch($p,'Matrix');
00025   if (Value::classMatch($p,'Point','Vector')) {$p = $p->data}
00026   elsif (scalar(@d) == 1) {$p = [$p->value]}
00027   elsif (scalar(@d) == 2 && $d[0] == 1) {$p = ($p->value)[0]}
00028   elsif (scalar(@d) == 2 && $d[1] == 1) {$p = ($p->transpose->value)[0]}
00029   else {
00030     $p = [$p] if defined($p) && ref($p) ne 'ARRAY';
00031     Value::Error("Vectors must have at least one coordinate") unless defined($p) && scalar(@{$p}) > 0;
00032     foreach my $x (@{$p}) {
00033       $x = Value::makeValue($x,context=>$context);
00034       $isFormula = 1 if Value::isFormula($x);
00035       Value::Error("Coordinate of Vector can't be %s",Value::showClass($x))
00036         unless Value::isNumber($x);
00037     }
00038   }
00039   if ($isFormula) {
00040     my $v = $self->formula($p);
00041     if (ref($self) && $self->{ColumnVector}) {
00042       $v->{tree}{ColumnVector} = 1;
00043       $v->{tree}{open} = $v->{tree}{close} = undef;
00044     }
00045     return $v;
00046   }
00047   my $v = bless {data => $p, context => $context}, $class;
00048   $v->{ColumnVector} = 1 if ref($self) && $self->{ColumnVector};
00049   return $v;
00050 }
00051 
00052 #
00053 #  Try to promote arbitary data to a vector
00054 #
00055 sub promote {
00056   my $self = shift; my $class = ref($self) || $self;
00057   my $context = (Value::isContext($_[0]) ? shift : $self->context);
00058   my $x = (scalar(@_) ? shift : $self);
00059   return $self->new($context,$x,@_) if scalar(@_) > 0 || ref($x) eq 'ARRAY';
00060   $x = Value::makeValue($x,context=>$context);
00061   return $x->inContext($context) if ref($x) eq $class;
00062   return $self->make($context,$x->value)->inherit($x->without('open','close')) if Value::classMatch($x,'Point');
00063   Value::Error("Can't convert %s to %s",Value::showClass($x),Value::showClass($self));
00064 }

00069 #
00070 #  Operations on vectors
00071 #
00072 
00073 sub add {
00074   my ($self,$l,$r,$other) = Value::checkOpOrderWithPromote(@_);
00075   my @l = $l->value; my @r = $r->value;
00076   Value::Error("Can't add Vectors with different numbers of coordinates")
00077     unless scalar(@l) == scalar(@r);
00078   my @s = ();
00079   foreach my $i (0..scalar(@l)-1) {push(@s,$l[$i] + $r[$i])}
00080   return $self->inherit($other)->make(@s);
00081 }
00082 
00083 sub sub {
00084   my ($self,$l,$r,$other) = Value::checkOpOrderWithPromote(@_);
00085   my @l = $l->value; my @r = $r->value;
00086   Value::Error("Can't subtract Vectors with different numbers of coordinates")
00087     unless scalar(@l) == scalar(@r);
00088   my @s = ();
00089   foreach my $i (0..scalar(@l)-1) {push(@s,$l[$i] - $r[$i])}
00090   return $self->inherit($other)->make(@s);
00091 }
00092 
00093 sub mult {
00094   my ($l,$r,$flag) = @_; my $self = $l;
00095   Value::Error("Vectors can only be multiplied by Numbers")
00096     unless (Value::matchNumber($r) || Value::isComplex($r));
00097   my @coords = ();
00098   foreach my $x ($l->value) {push(@coords,$x*$r)}
00099   return $self->make(@coords);
00100 }
00101 
00102 sub div {
00103   my ($l,$r,$flag) = @_; my $self = $l;
00104   Value::Error("Can't divide by a Vector") if $flag;
00105   Value::Error("Vectors can only be divided by Numbers")
00106     unless (Value::matchNumber($r) || Value::isComplex($r));
00107   Value::Error("Division by zero") if $r == 0;
00108   my @coords = ();
00109   foreach my $x ($l->value) {push(@coords,$x/$r)}
00110   return $self->make(@coords);
00111 }
00112 
00113 sub power {
00114   my ($l,$r,$flag) = @_;
00115   Value::Error("Can't raise Vectors to powers") unless $flag;
00116   Value::Error("Can't use Vectors in exponents");
00117 }
00118 
00119 sub dot {
00120   my ($self,$l,$r) = Value::checkOpOrderWithPromote(@_);
00121   my @l = $l->value; my @r = $r->value;
00122   Value::Error("Can't dot Vectors with different numbers of coordinates")
00123     unless scalar(@l) == scalar(@r);
00124   my $s = 0;
00125   foreach my $i (0..scalar(@l)-1) {$s += $l[$i] * $r[$i]}
00126   return $s;
00127 }
00128 
00129 sub cross {
00130   my ($self,$l,$r,$other) = Value::checkOpOrderWithPromote(@_);
00131   my @l = $l->value; my @r = $r->value;
00132   Value::Error("Vectors for cross product must be in 3-space")
00133     unless scalar(@l) == 3 && scalar(@r) == 3;
00134   $self->inherit($other)->make($l[1]*$r[2] - $l[2]*$r[1],
00135                              -($l[0]*$r[2] - $l[2]*$r[0]),
00136                                $l[0]*$r[1] - $l[1]*$r[0]);
00137 }
00138 
00139 #
00140 #  If vectors are different length, shorter is smaller,
00141 #  Otherwise, do lexicographic comparison.
00142 #
00143 sub compare {
00144   my ($self,$l,$r) = Value::checkOpOrderWithPromote(@_);
00145   my @l = $l->value; my @r = $r->value;
00146   if (scalar(@l) != scalar(@r)) {
00147     return scalar(@l) <=> scalar(@r) unless
00148        ($l->getFlag("ijk") || $r->getFlag("ijk")) &&
00149        ($l->getFlag("ijkAnyDimension") || $r->getFlag("ijkAnyDimension"));
00150     if (scalar(@l) < scalar(@r)) {push(@l,0 x (scalar(@r)-scalar(@l)))}
00151                             else {push(@r,0 x (scalar(@l)-scalar(@r)))}
00152   }
00153   my $cmp = 0;
00154   foreach my $i (0..scalar(@l)-1) {
00155     $cmp = $l[$i] <=> $r[$i];
00156     last if $cmp;
00157   }
00158   return $cmp;
00159 }
00160 
00161 sub neg {
00162   my $self = promote(@_); my @coords = ();
00163   foreach my $x ($self->value) {push(@coords,-$x)}
00164   return $self->make(@coords);
00165 }

00167 sub abs {(shift)->norm(@_)}
00168 sub norm {
00169   my $self = promote(@_);
00170   my $s = $self->Package("Real")->make($self->context,0);
00171   foreach my $x ($self->value) {$s += $x*$x}
00172   return CORE::sqrt($s);
00173 }
00174 
00175 sub unit {
00176   my $self = promote(@_);
00177   my $n = $self->norm; return $self if $n == 0; # fuzzy check
00178   return $self / $n;
00179 }

00181 ############################################
00182 #
00183 #  Check for parallel vectors
00184 #
00185 
00186 sub isParallel {
00187   my $self = (ref($_[0]) ? $_[0] : shift);
00188   my $U = $self->promote(shift); my $V = $self->promote(shift);
00189   my $context =  $self->context;
00190   my $sameDirection = shift;
00191   my @u = $U->value; my @v = $V->value;
00192   if (scalar(@u) != scalar(@v)) {
00193     return 0 unless
00194        ($U->getFlag("ijk") || $V->getFlag("ijk")) &&
00195        ($U->getFlag("ijkAnyDimension") || $V->getFlag("ijkAnyDimension"));
00196     if (scalar(@u) < scalar(@v)) {push(@u,0 x (scalar(@v)-scalar(@u)))}
00197                             else {push(@v,0 x (scalar(@u)-scalar(@v)))}
00198   }
00199   my $k = ''; # will be scaling factor for u = k v
00200   foreach my $i (0..$#u) {
00201     #
00202     #  make sure we use fuzzy math
00203     #
00204     $u[$i] = $context->Package("Real")->new($context,$u[$i]) unless Value::isReal($u[$i]);
00205     $v[$i] = $context->Package("Real")->new($context,$v[$i]) unless Value::isReal($v[$i]);
00206     if ($k ne '') {
00207       return 0 if ($v[$i] != $k*$u[$i]);
00208     } else {
00209       #
00210       #  if one is zero and the other isn't then not parallel
00211       #  otherwise use the ratio of the two as k.
00212       #
00213       if ($u[$i] == 0) {
00214     return 0 if $v[$i] != 0;
00215       } else {
00216     return 0 if $v[$i] == 0;
00217     $k = ($v[$i]/$u[$i])->value;
00218         return 0 if $k < 0 && $sameDirection;
00219       }
00220     }
00221   }
00222   #
00223   #  Note: it will return 1 if both are zero vectors.  This is a
00224   #  feature, since one is provided by the problem writer, and he
00225   #  should only supply the zero vector if he means it.  One could
00226   #  return ($k ne '') to return 0 if both are zero.
00227   #
00228   return 1;
00229 }
00230 
00231 sub areParallel {(shift)->isParallel(@_)}

00234 ############################################
00235 #
00236 #  Generate the various output formats
00237 #
00238 
00239 my $ijk_string = ['i','j','k','0'];
00240 my $ijk_TeX = ['\boldsymbol{i}','\boldsymbol{j}','\boldsymbol{k}','\boldsymbol{0}'];
00241 
00242 sub string {
00243   my $self = shift; my $equation = shift;
00244   return $self->ijk($ijk_string) if $self->getFlag("ijk") && !$self->{ColumnVector};
00245   return $self->SUPER::string($equation,@_);
00246 }
00247 
00248 sub pdot {
00249   my $self = shift;
00250   my $string = $self->string;
00251   $string = '('.$string.')'
00252     if $string =~ m/[-+]/ && $self->getFlag("ijk") && !$self->{ColumnVector};
00253   return $string;
00254 }
00255 
00256 sub TeX {
00257   my $self = shift; my $equation = shift;
00258   if ($self->{ColumnVector}) {
00259     my $def = ($equation->{context} || $self->context)->lists->get('Matrix');
00260     my $open = shift; my $close = shift;
00261     $open  = $self->{open}  unless defined($open);
00262     $open  = $def->{open}   unless defined($open);
00263     $close = $self->{close} unless defined($close);
00264     $close = $def->{close}  unless defined($close);
00265     $open =~ s/([{}])/\\$1/g; $close =~ s/([{}])/\\$1/g;
00266     $open = '\left'.$open if $open; $close = '\right'.$close if $close;
00267     my @coords = ();
00268     foreach my $x (@{$self->data}) {
00269       if (Value::isValue($x)) {push(@coords,$x->TeX($equation))} else {push(@coords,$x)}
00270     }
00271     return $open.'\begin{array}{c}'.join('\\\\',@coords).'\\\\\end{array}'.$close;
00272   }
00273   return $self->ijk if $self->getFlag("ijk");
00274   return $self->SUPER::TeX($equation,@_);
00275 }
00276 
00277 sub ijk {
00278   my $self = shift; my $ijk = shift;
00279   if (!$ijk) {
00280     my $context = $self->context;
00281     $ijk = []; $ijk->[3] = $ijk_TeX->[3];
00282     foreach my $i (0,1,2)
00283       {$ijk->[$i] = $context->{constants}{$ijk_string->[$i]}{TeX} || $ijk_TeX->[$i]}
00284   }
00285   my @coords = @{$self->data};
00286   Value::Error("Method 'ijk' can only be used on Vectors in 3-space")
00287     unless (scalar(@coords) <= 3);
00288   my $string = ''; my $n; my $term;
00289   foreach $n (0..scalar(@coords)-1) {
00290     $term = $coords[$n]; $term = (Value::isValue($term))? $term->string : "$term";
00291     if ($term ne 0) {
00292       $term = '' if $term eq '1'; $term = '-' if $term eq '-1';
00293       $term = '('.$term.')' if $term =~ m/e/i;
00294       $term = '+' . $term unless $string eq '' or $term =~ m/^-/;
00295       $string .= $term . $ijk->[$n];
00296     }
00297   }
00298   $string = $ijk->[3] if $string eq '';
00299   return $string;
00300 }
